question: I am a 38 and female. I recently had some blood tests done due to some symptoms of: blurred vision, dizziness, fatigue, headache, night sweats, abdominal pain on the left side and some nausea, nosebleeds, numbness in feet, weightloss (50 -60 lbs in 7 mos), Joint and bone pain, weakness, Type 2 diabetes well controlled, lumps that come and go in my armpits, and leg and foot cramps. I had a referral to rheumatologist for the joint and muscle pain. She assessed that I had no arthritis or autoimmune issues. I have no infections known of. The Drs. do not seem concerned, but I am concerned with the symptoms combined with abnormal results. I'm concerned about maybe MGUS or cancers, as they run in the family. What are your thoughts?Tests were as follows:C-Reactive Protein – 16.7  H  (<3.0)SPE:Albumin – 3.0 L (3.4-5.0)Alpha-1  - 0.3 (.15-.30)Alpha-2 – 1.5 H (.65-1.20)Beta – 1.5 H (.8-1.2)Gamma – 2.1 H  (.7-1.8)Total Protein  9.1 H  (6.4-8.2)A/G ratio – 0.7No Rheum. Factorelevated ESR: 61, then 44ANA – NegativeAnti-CCP – NegativeHLA – B27 – Negativehgb-A1C – 7.0 – well controlledWBC – 11.6  H  (norm 4.8 – 10.8)Platelets 1+ enlargedImmature platelet factor – 12%, (norm 1.7 – 7.1%)MonocytosisLymphocytocisPlatelet count – 180 (norm 130-450)Hematocrit – 33.2%vL (37-47%)Mcv – 76  L (83-97)Mch- 23.8 L (83-97)Mchc – 31.3  L (32.2 – 35.5)RDW – 16.0% H (11.5 – 15.5)Lymph – 3.3 H (1.1-3.0)Mono – 0.8 H (0.1-0.75)Cholesterol – 148 (<200)Creatinine: 0.19 L (.40-1.10)Sodium, potassium, chloride, magnesium – all normalTSH – 2.4   (.36-3.74)BUN: 6  L  (7-22)
title: Symptoms and Test results. Cancers/MGUS? Other Possibilities?
